info.name: soft shadows through holes
info.description:
sky lighting on screen via occluder with holes (radius r, height h to screen). 
#THIN=0 -> thick
Ref image (see bottom) from "strange shadows" [url]https://www.boredpanda.com/amazing-shadows-optical-illusions/[/url]:
uh, maybe wrong light source model.

renderpass.code:
#define THIN 1  // 1: no thickness 0: thickness = 2e

void mainImage( out vec4 O, vec2 U )
{
    float h = .01 + .6*(.5+.5*sin(iTime)),    // distance occluder-screen
          r = .3,                             // holes radius
          e = .15/2.,                         // occluder thickness/2
          I = 4.;                             // source intensity
          
    O -= O;

    U *= 4. / iResolution.y;                  // scaling
    U.x -= .5 * mod(floor(U.y),2.);
    U = fract( U ) - .5;                      // local coordinates % hole center

    for (int k=0; k<25; k++) {                // accounts for center + neighbor cells
        vec2 P = vec2(k%5-2,k/5-2);
        P.x -= .5 * mod(floor(P.y),2.);       // hole center
        float d = length( U-P ),              // distance to it
              a = atan(h,d-r) - atan(h,d+r);  // hole (thus sky) apperture from pixel on screen        
#if THIN // thin occluder
        a *= a;                               // solid angle = PI.(a/2)Â²
#else // thick occluder (approx footprint by ellipse)
        a *=   max( atan(h+e,d-r), atan(h-e,d-r) )
             - max( atan(h+e,d+r), atan(h-e,d+r) );
#endif
        O +=  a / 8.; // hole (thus sky) solid angle / 2Pi from pixel on screen
    }
    
    O = pow( I*O, vec4(1./2.2) );             // to sRGB / gamma
}
